TITLE: Europe inflation may spike on Olympics and Taylor Swift, but UBS says it won't hit locals' wallets
SUMMARY: According to UBS, the Paris Olympics, as well as the Eras Tour, are causing demand shocks without impacting the average consumers' spending power.

TITLE: The unemployment insurance program is unprepared for a recession, experts say
SUMMARY: Unemployment insurance is meant to prop up income after a layoff. The system buckled during the pandemic and is ill equipped for another crisis, experts said.

TITLE: JPMorgan Chase is giving its employees an AI assistant powered by ChatGPT maker OpenAI
SUMMARY: The move by JPMorgan, the largest U.S. bank by assets, shows how quickly generative AI has swept through America since the arrival of ChatGPT in late 2022.

TITLE: Container explodes on cargo ship at China's key Ningbo port
SUMMARY: A hazardous goods container exploded Friday on a ship operating in China's Ningbo Port, vessel owner Yang Ming told CNBC in a statement.

TITLE: Italy looks like fertile ground for a mega merger deal in banking
SUMMARY: Years after a debt crisis in the region and a government rescue for Banca Monte dei Paschi, analysts are looking at Italy's banking sector with fresh eyes.

TITLE: Banks face tough new security standards in the EU — their tech suppliers are under scrutiny, too
SUMMARY: By January 2025, banks and their tech suppliers will have to comply with a new EU law known as DORA. It could help prevent major IT disruptions in future.

TITLE: Jamie Dimon says he still sees a recession on the horizon
SUMMARY: Dimon, leader of the biggest U.S. bank by assets and one of the most respected voices on Wall Street, has warned of an economic "hurricane" since 2022.

TITLE: A 'soft landing' is still on the table, economists say
SUMMARY: Recession risks have risen but the U.S. is likely to skirt a downturn if the Federal Reserve soon cuts interest rates, economists said.

TITLE: Sahm Rule creator doesn't think that the Fed needs an emergency rate cut
SUMMARY: She said, however, there is a good case for a 50 basis point cut, adding that the Fed needs to "back off" its restrictive monetary policy.

TITLE: Consumer giants from Starbucks to General Mills have one big sales problem: China
SUMMARY: A theme emerging in the latest slew of U.S. companies' earnings reports is a drag from the China market.

TITLE: The case for buying bonds right now
SUMMARY: Investors may want to consider fixed income to help navigate the market’s recent volatility.

TITLE: Markets are counting on the Fed to head off recession with sizable interest rate cuts
SUMMARY: How Chair Jerome Powell and his cohorts react likely will go a long way in determining how investors negotiate a turbulent climate.

TITLE: San Francisco Fed President Daly sees interest rate cuts coming as labor market weakens
SUMMARY: Progress on inflation and a clear slowdown in hiring likely will drive the Fed to some extent of policy easing, Daly said Monday.

TITLE: Summer is ‘high season’ for flight delays. Here’s what travelers need to know
SUMMARY: Financial compensation for flight delay and cancelation varies by airline.

TITLE: JPMorgan Chase is opening more small-town branches in middle America
SUMMARY: CEO Jamie Dimon is embarking on his 14th annual bus tour on Monday, with his first stop in Iowa, where the bank plans to open 25 more branches by 2030.

TITLE: Chicago Fed President Goolsbee says if economy deteriorates, Fed will 'fix it'
SUMMARY: Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee spoke Monday morning on CNBC's "Squawk Box."

TITLE: Apple shares drop nearly 5% after Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway slashes stake by half
SUMMARY: Berkshire Hathaway disclosed in its earnings filing that it dumped a little more than 49% of the Apple stake.

TITLE: ETF inflows set record high in July, State Street Global Advisors finds
SUMMARY: New data shows exchange-traded fund inflows hit $127 billion last month.

TITLE: Warren Buffett raises Berkshire cash level to record $277 billion after slashing stock holdings
SUMMARY: Berkshire Hathaway's cash pile swelled to a record $276.9 billion as Warren Buffett continued dumping his one-time favorite Apple stake.

TITLE: Berkshire's mounting cash pile could top $200 billion as Buffett continues selling stock
SUMMARY: The Omaha-based conglomerate's cash hoard is likely to exceed its previous record of $189 billion when it reports quarterly earnings Saturday.

TITLE: Morgan Stanley tells wealth advisors they can pitch bitcoin ETFs in a first for a big bank
SUMMARY: The move from Morgan Stanley, one of the world's largest wealth management firms, is the latest sign of the adoption of bitcoin by mainstream finance.

TITLE: Here’s where the jobs are for July — in one chart
SUMMARY: Hiring in the U.S. slowed significantly last month with information and financial sectors leading the job losses.

TITLE: Buffett's Berkshire sells $3.8 billion worth of Bank of America in 12-day selling spree
SUMMARY: Berkshire Hathaway dumped a total of 19.2 million BofA shares over the past three days for almost $779 million, according to a new regulatory filing.

TITLE: Singapore's monetary authority sets up review group in bid to revive its equities market
SUMMARY: MAS said one goal will be to identify methods for encouraging participation, including from capital market intermediaries, investors and listed companies.

TITLE: Stocks making the biggest moves after hours: Apple, Amazon, Intel, Snap and more
SUMMARY: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in extended trading.

TITLE: Here's what changed in the new Fed statement
SUMMARY: This is a comparison of Wednesday's Federal Open Market Committee statement with the one issued after the Fed's previous policymaking meeting in June.

TITLE: Fed holds rates steady and notes progress on inflation
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials held short-term interest rates steady, but indicated that inflation is getting closer to its 2% target.

TITLE: This AI-powered financial advisor has quickly gained $20 billion in assets
SUMMARY: The wealth management industry has long feared a future where human advisors are no longer necessary, and that possibility seems closer with generative AI.

TITLE: Here's everything you need to know about the Fed decision coming Wednesday
SUMMARY: This week's Federal Reserve meeting might not have much bearing on the present but  potentially it could have a lot to do with the future.

TITLE: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway sells Bank of America for a ninth straight day
SUMMARY: Over the past nine trading sessions, Berkshire has cut its BofA stake by 71.2 million shares with just more than $3 billion of sales.
